name: Comparative Development in Political Perspective
description: This course examines the role of politics and the state in the processes of development in less developed countries. Topics include the role of the military and bureaucracy, the relationship between the state and the economy, and the role of religion and ethnicity in politics.Area of Focus: Comparative Politics
prerequisites: POLB90H3 Note: It is strongly recommended that students take POLB90H3 and POLB91H3 in consecutive sessions.
